revised_title: The Effect of Caustic Potash, Tartaric Acid, and Tartrate of Potash on the Acidity of the Urine
tldr: The author investigates the effects of caustic potash, tartaric acid, and tartrate of potash on the acidity of urine. The results show that large doses of liquor potassee can significantly decrease urine acidity, but do not render it constantly alkaline. Tartaric acid also affects urine acidity, with eighty-four grains causing pain in the bowels.
